result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Wright Rouse

records.addlTxt:
**UNSIGNED** ( bond amended due to block being added)
Standard Conditions
Additional Conditions: 
No contact directly or indirectly with the party/parties named in the bail bond, no contact at their residence/property(may only have contact with victim 1 with a certified counselor). 
Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia. 
Pick up personal belongings with police escort. 
Comply with day reporting requirements; Monitor alcohol abstinence-device to be determined by Day Reporting Staff.

11:23 AM Defendant Michael Wright Rouse appeared by phone.  Attorney Tayyibah Ingrid Sethi appeared by phone for Michael Wright Rouse.  Attorney Rebecca Mayer appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. 950/Marsy's Law complied with. Atty Sethi argues bond for no violent or abusive contact, CPS involved. Victim makes a statement to the Court. State objects to modification of bond. Court respectfully denies bond request by Atty Sethi for the many reasons stated on the record.
Bail/bond hearing on September 27, 2022 at 10:30 am.
